derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from medieval Latin venae sectio(n-) 'cutting of a vein'

means.word_mean: 1. surgical incision into a vein; used to treat hemochromatosis

auth_sentence.content: Blood venesection on these rats reduced the iron load in the liver and pancreas, and ameliorated the general diabetic symptoms.
